"The common law makes that which is fraudulent in fact void; but in all cases of confederate fraud, its maxim is in pari delicto, potior est conditio defendentis. Neither party will be aided or relieved against a contract executed by him."

referencing the principle that contracts in violation of a statute are unenforceable, albeit the parties may be in pari delicto, "however ungracious and abhorrent to our sense of justice such a defence may be" in the particular case
